verses.kjv: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,
verses.ct: So if you find any encouragement in Christ, if love brings any comfort, if you share anything together through the Spirit, if you have any compassion and tenderness,

verses.kjv: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.
verses.ct: then make my joy complete by being united in thought, sharing the same love, and being one in heart and purpose.

verses.kjv: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.
verses.ct: Don't do anything out of selfish ambition or empty pride. Instead, with humility, consider others as more important than yourselves.

verses.kjv: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.
verses.ct: Each of you should pay attention not only to your own interests but also to the interests of others.

verses.kjv: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:
verses.ct: Adopt the same attitude that Christ Jesus had:

verses.kjv: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:
verses.ct: Although he existed in the very nature of God, he didn't consider his equality with God something to cling to.

verses.kjv: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:
verses.ct: Instead, he gave up everything, taking on the nature of a servant and becoming human.

verses.kjv: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.
verses.ct: Appearing as an ordinary person, he humbled himself and was obedient all the way to death — even death on a cross.

verses.kjv: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:
verses.ct: That is why God raised him to the highest place and gave him the name that surpasses every other name,

verses.kjv: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;
verses.ct: so that at the name of Jesus every knee will bow — in heaven, on earth, and under the earth —

verses.kjv: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
verses.ct: and every tongue will declare that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
verses.ct: Therefore, my dear friends, just as you have always been obedient — not only when I was with you, but even more now that I'm away — continue to live out your salvation with deep reverence and trembling.

verses.kjv: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
verses.ct: Because it is God who is at work within you, giving you both the desire and the ability to carry out his good purpose.

verses.kjv: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:
verses.ct: Do everything without complaining or arguing,

verses.kjv: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;
verses.ct: so that you will be faultless and pure, children of God without any blemish, living in the middle of a corrupt and twisted generation. Among them you shine like stars in the world,

verses.kjv: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.
verses.ct: as you hold out the message of life. Then on the day of Christ I can be proud that my effort and hard work were not wasted.

verses.kjv: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.
verses.ct: Yes, and even if my life is poured out like a drink offering on top of the sacrifice and service that comes from your faith, I am glad and rejoice with all of you.

verses.kjv: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.
verses.ct: In the same way, you too should be glad and rejoice with me.

verses.kjv: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.
verses.ct: I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus to you soon, so that I can be encouraged when I hear how you're doing.

verses.kjv: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
verses.ct: I have no one else like him who genuinely cares about your well-being.

verses.kjv: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.
verses.ct: Everyone else is focused on their own concerns rather than the things of Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.
verses.ct: But you know his proven character — like a son working alongside his father, he has served with me in spreading the gospel.

verses.kjv: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.
verses.ct: So I hope to send him as soon as I can see how things turn out for me.

verses.kjv: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.
verses.ct: And I'm confident in the Lord that I myself will also come to you soon.

verses.kjv: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.
verses.ct: But I thought it was necessary to send Epaphroditus back to you — my brother, coworker, and fellow soldier, who is also your messenger and the one who took care of my needs.

verses.kjv: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.
verses.ct: He has been longing to see all of you and was deeply distressed because you heard that he had been sick.

verses.kjv: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
verses.ct: He really was sick, close to dying. But God had mercy on him — and not just on him, but on me as well, so that I wouldn't have one grief piled on top of another.

verses.kjv: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.
verses.ct: So I am sending him back all the more eagerly, so that when you see him again you'll be happy, and my own worry will be relieved.

verses.kjv: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:
verses.ct: Welcome him in the Lord with complete joy, and hold people like him in high regard.

verses.kjv: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.
verses.ct: Because he nearly died for the work of Christ, risking his own life to make up for the help you couldn't personally give me.
